extraction_metadata.notes: Trial notable for: (1) accused released after torture without confession; (2) relationship with Catherine (healer/cunning woman); (3) shape-shifting reputation (mistaken for horse); (4) plague dispute context; (5) multiple family members calling her witch but accused not seeking legal redress; (6) accused had difficult family situation (crying children, sleeping apart from husband). Change de Nancy approved torture but also approved release when she refused to confess.
